name: Dune Hua Hin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very small hotel, with very stylish rooms. However, because of its small size, some amenities are lacking. For example hotel pool is very small. There is the owner's pool next door but it's not the same as having a proper pool in your own building. Stretch of the beach is so so, and hotel is not actually on the beach but a few meters away. No proper parking is also a pain. However, service is good and smiley, breakfast is decent for a place this size. Not recommended for families/kids. Alright for couples looking to unwind. Weak point is the bar on the rooftop is quite popular at night, so bar customers walking up and down the stairs can be noisy for actual guests. Still a nice little hotel in a decent part of town but there are many stylish options with more amenities/facilities in hua hin in this price range which may be better contenders.
reviews.title: Cute hotel

reviews.text: Dune is a great little hotel. Close enough to town but just far away enough from the craziness. The beach in Hua Hin is nothing special so the rooftop pool really comes into its own. The staff seemed to be smiling from the moment we arrived til the moment we left. English isn't perfect but you'll get by okay
reviews.title: Dune is a great little hotel. Close...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dune is a cool little hotel in Hua Hin. The location is OK, near the king's palace, but not that close to the main areas of Hua Hin. The room was great, comfortable bed, spectacular bathroom. Roof top deck and breakfast room were also well appointed.
reviews.title: Very cool spot in Hua Hin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This IS a cleverly designed small hotel, in a good position, near everything you might need. Very quiet and restful. The staff are impeccable in their attention to your needs. The food is excellent, The breakfast is a real pleasure. The most important things for us was the attention given to practical details, such as good quality clothes hangers, ground coffee in the room, not just instant. Immediate attention if you needed assistance. High quality inscape decor and technology. Super bed.
reviews.title: a great discovery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small contemporary boutique hotel with only 4 rooms and one private pool suite. A few steps from the beach. Rooms are creatively named ONE TWO THREE FOUR & FIVE. We booked the Dune Suite which was ONE - round the corner from the reception and side street which made it awesomely easy to go out and return, check-in and check-out. Small garden opens into a lovely 5mx2m pool, a comfortable day bed, glass door opens to a comfortable king size bed, flat screen TV, Denon amplifier & i-Pod dock. The bathroom is heavenly contemporary with a large stand alone bathtub. Very tastefully done. The twin headed Grohe shower in the separate standing shower should be fixed as there was a spraying leak when you turn the shower on. The service was hospitable & prompt. The spa ladies who came to our room daily were wonderful & friendly. The food is EXCELLENT!!! I love snowfish... and the parsley crusted snowfish was heavenly. The wasabe mayonaise sauce for the deep fried calamari was fantastic, so was the roti with masamman curry. The complimentary mini bar was generous, and the cashews and M&Ms were replenished daily. The speakers are all hooked up to the entertainment unit - so you get music individually controlled in the bedroom, bathroom and swimming pool. It was a wonderful getaway in a small private hotel, in a generous sized room.
reviews.title: Well-Chill ed at the Dune

likes.liked: — contemporary design with a private pool

reviews.text: Dune Hua Hin is absolutely fantastic, in every way. It is a truly boutique hotel with only 5 rooms and each room is appointed beautfully. The staff are excellent, and the roof top restaurant and pool have views over the ocean and down towards the main Hua Hin town. I have stayed in many hotels in Hua Hin and this is by the far the best, and most unique of them all. Friendly, personalised service in serene surroundings. Just about perfect in every way.
reviews.title: DUNE - Stunning boutique hotel

reviews.text: I was recommended to this hotel by the excellent front desk team at the Met in Bangkok, I wanted a small modern 'Hip' hotel, and that was exactly what I got.
reviews.title: Real Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at Dune and thought the hotel and staff were lovely - most of the time we had the hotel to ourselves. The pool is great and gives you a nice view over the ocean. My only comment would be that if you want to stay somewhere that has direct access to the beach this is not it. However it is nice to be a little away from Hua Hin as the town was not what we had hoped. But the hotel is very nice if you want a more intimate experience.
reviews.title: Great Hotel location could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent and chic small hotel. Only 5 min tuk tuk ride away from Hua Hin centre. For a relaxing stay, I would recommend to stay outside of the neon/Scandinavianized hotel hub downtown.
reviews.title: Chic hotel, cool roof top terrace and pool

likes.liked: — Rooms, balconies, roof top pool and terrace, restaurant, and the DOUBLE SHOWER in the bathroom - excellent!
likes.disliked: — Poor beach access, however, great pool at the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked via Agoda.com (best prices!) and had a lovely stay for our honeymoon (however, we did not receive any special honeymoon benefits at Dune). It seemed we were the only guests at the hotel, very tranquil and calm, and the service was impeccable. We had the roof top pool all to ourselves. Perfect!
reviews.title: Nice, could be better

likes.disliked: — some things are a little worn out

description: A small exclusive beach boutique hotel features five modern stylish rooms with an utmost personalized service. You will be indulged with privacy and tranquility in the comfort of your fully-equipped room, while a lovely beach is only a stone throw away. The interior decoration is very minimalist in style but with a fine touch of details, a perfect combination of a modern concept of luxurious comfort lifestyle.
